title: GEMINI.md: Bryant 233x Boat Management
text:
This directory appears to be for the personal management and documentation of a 2013 Bryant 233x boat. It contains checklists for operation, official documentation like bills of sale, insurance and maintenance records, and pictures. The owner‚Äôs name appears to be Hank Murrah, and the boat is primarily used on Lake Martin.




Bryant233MarineAssistant.md: This is the primary knowledge base file for this project. It contains detailed operational, maintenance, and system-specific information for the Bryant 233x boat. This file should be used as the main context for any AI assistant interactions.





checklists/: This directory contains Quarto (.qmd) source files and their rendered PDF versions for various boat operations.

bryant-staging-launch-checklist.qmd: A detailed checklist for preparing the boat for launch at the ramp.
bryant-trailering-checklist.qmd: A checklist for safely trailering the boat with a Ford F-150 and a 2016 Magic Tilt Tandem trailer.
safety-briefing.qmd: A script for the captain‚Äôs pre-launch safety briefing for passengers.

documentation/: Contains official records for the boat and trailer. This includes what appears to be a bill of sale and registration documents.
insurance/: Contains the boat‚Äôs insurance documents.
maintenance/: Contains maintenance records for the boat. This includes records from ‚Äú280 Marine‚Äù and ‚ÄúHarris Performance‚Äù.
pictures/: Contains photos of the boat, including pictures of the house and starter batteries.




This directory is used as a central repository for all information related to the Bryant 233x boat. The checklists can be used to ensure safe and repeatable operations, and the other directories provide a place to store important records. The .qmd files in the checklists directory can be edited and re-rendered to produce updated PDF checklists.

title: SYSTEM CONTEXT: Hank‚Äôs Marine Assistant (Bryant 233X)
text:
Role: Expert Marine Mechanic & Operations Specialist for Auburn/Lake Martin area. Primary Asset: 2013 Bryant 233 X (Mercruiser 350 MAG / Bravo III). Owner: Hank. Current Location: Auburn, Alabama (Winter Storage). Current Status: WINTERIZED (On Trailer).
Core Operating Principles: 1. Safety & Reliability First: All advice prioritizes passenger safety and the longevity of the engine/drive. 2. Owner‚Äôs Rep: Manage vendor relationships (specifically Jim @ 280 Marine), track quotes, and verify work orders. 3. No Beaching Policy: Strict adherence to ‚ÄúOffshore Anchoring‚Äù due to the Bravo III outdrive. 4. Specificity: Advice must be specific to the Mercruiser 350 MAG and Bravo III systems.





Vessel: 2013 Bryant 233 X (‚ÄúSurf Edition‚Äù)
Engine: Mercruiser 350 MAG MPI (300hp, V8).
Cooling: Raw Water Cooled (Open loop).
Drive: Mercruiser Bravo III (Dual counter-rotating stainless props).
Fuel Capacity: 49 Gallons.
Fuel Requirement: 87 Octane Non-Ethanol (Preferred).

Protocol: If E10 is used, STA-BIL 360 Marine is mandatory.

Key Features: Integrated 3-bag ballast system, upgraded stereo, SeaDek flooring.





Make: 2016 Magic Tilt Tandem Axle.
Tires: ST205/75R14 (5-lug pattern).
Hitch: 2‚Äù Ball.
Electrical Connection: 5-Pin Flat.

Tow Vehicle Note: Hank‚Äôs F-150 requires a 7-way Round to 5-pin Flat adapter to activate the reverse lockout solenoid (prevents trailer brakes from locking when backing up).









Winterization (Nov 2025): Engine block drained, propylene glycol run through raw water system, ballast pumps drained/cleared.
Throttle/Shift Feel: Confirmed functional. Requires pushing slightly past the detent to engage forward gear. Verified by Jim @ 280 Marine as standard wear/design.
Mooring Cover: Rip patched with Gorilla Tape. Replacement deferred for 1-2 seasons.





Steering Cable: Status: QUOTED. stiff operation. Needs replacement. Vendor: Jim @ 280 Marine.
Trim Gauge: Status: QUOTED. Diagnosis confirmed faulty dashboard gauge (sender is likely fine). Vendor: Jim @ 280 Marine.
Manifolds & Risers: Status: MONITOR. Original hardware (12 years old). History is freshwater, so immediate replacement isn‚Äôt critical, but they are approaching end-of-life.

Action: Monitor engine temps closely. Plan for ‚ÄúJoint Inspection‚Äù (pulling risers to check gasket surfaces) next off-season.






Bilge Float Switch: Status: UNKNOWN. Automatic function must be tested before launch.
Trailer Tires: Status: INSPECT. Need to check 4-digit Date Codes on sidewalls. If >6 years old, replace immediately regardless of tread depth.
Docking Lights: Status: BROKEN. Starboard light inoperative (bulb confirmed good). Likely a ground/wiring fault behind the fixture.









Blower Protocol: Run blower for minimum 4 minutes before key-turn. Perform ‚ÄúSniff Test‚Äù of bilge.
Battery Switch: Ensure switch is ON before launch.
Trailer Depth: Do not submerge trailer past the fender tops (adjust for ramp steepness).





Depth Requirement: Minimum 4 feet of water under the drive.
Method: Two-Anchor Setup.

Drop Bow Anchor first upwind/current.
Back down to set.
Deploy Stern Anchor to prevent swing.

Shore Access: Ferry passengers and gear using a towable tube or raft.
Swimming Safety: ABSOLUTELY NO swimming near the stern while the engine is running (CO poisoning risk).





Procedure: Engine OFF, Blower ON, all passengers OFF the boat.
Additives: Add STA-BIL 360 before pumping fuel to ensure mixing.







Primary Mechanic: Jim @ 280 Marine.
Relationship Status: Good. We trust his diagnosis on the Manifolds (Freshwater history) and the Shifter feel.

title: Trailer Profile: 2016 Magic Tilt
text:
Trailer: 2016 Magic Tilt Tandem Axle
Vessel: 2013 Bryant 233 X



Make: Magic Tilt
Year: 2016
Type: Tandem Axle Aluminum I-Beam (Assumed based on typical Magic Tilt construction for this class, verify visual)
Tire Size: ST205/75R14
Lug Pattern: 5-Lug
Hitch Size: 2‚Äù Ball
Electrical: 5-Pin Flat





Vehicle: Ford F-150
Adapter: 7-way Round to 5-pin Flat adapter is REQUIRED.

Reason: The 5th pin activates the reverse lockout solenoid on the trailer tongue. Without this, the trailer brakes will lock up when backing up (especially uphill).

Tongue: Folding tongue (must be secured for towing).
Tie-Downs: Two (2) Transom Ratchet Straps (Frame to Stern Eyes).













Component
Status
Priority
Notes




Tires
üî¥ INSPECT
CRITICAL
Action: Check 4-digit Date Codes on all 4 sidewalls. If >6 years old, replace immediately regardless of tread. Size: ST205/75R14.


Bearings
üü° Monitor
High
Action: Check hub temps after 15 mins of highway driving. Should be warm to touch, NOT hot. Grease annually.


Brakes
üü° Monitor
Medium
Reverse lockout solenoid requires 5-pin connection. Check fluid level in tongue actuator.


Lights
üü° Monitor
Medium
LED lights. Unplug before backing into water (prevents thermal shock if not sealed perfectly).


Winch Strap
üü¢ Good
Low
Inspect for fraying.







Backing Up: If brakes lock up, check the electrical connection. If the truck plug is dead, use the manual ‚Äúlockout key‚Äù (if available) or insert a pin/coin into the side of the tongue actuator to physically block compression.
Launch Depth: Do not submerge trailer past the fender tops. Adjust for ramp steepness.
Storage: Chock wheels. Leave brake actuator uncompressed.

title: Project: Trailer Guidepost Installation
text: Objective: Install rear guideposts on the 2016 Magic Tilt trailer to assist with centering the Bryant 233x during retrieval, especially in cross-currents or wind.

title: Project: Trailer Guidepost Installation
text:
1. Baseline Data

Trailer: 2016 Magic Tilt Tandem Axle.
Frame Type: Aluminum Square Tube (3‚Äù x 3‚Äù O.D., as measured).
Reference Image: pictures/bryant-trailer-rear crossbar-1.jpg.

Observation: The image shows two (2) U-bolts on each side of the rear crossbar.
U-bolt Dimensions: Inside dimensions of U-bolts are 1 1/8‚Äù x 1 1/8‚Äù, with approximately 22-24‚Äù of usable leg length/depth.
Hypothesis: These U-bolts may be retained hardware from a previous guidepost installation, potentially forming a mounting point or ‚Äúsocket‚Äù for guide post supports.

title: Project: Trailer Guidepost Installation
text:
2. Requirements & Research
To select the correct kit, we need to determine:

Existing Hardware Feasibility:

Can we reuse the existing U-bolts? Yes, confirmed.
Strategy: Measurements confirm a 1.5‚Äù x 1.5‚Äù square aluminum tubing will fit securely within the 1 1/8‚Äù U-bolt opening.
Benefit: If feasible, we only need to buy the tubing and PVC pipes, saving money on the mounting kit.

Mounting Location: Rear crossbar.
Beam Dimensions:

Crossbar: 3‚Äù x 3‚Äù (Outside Diameter).

Guide Post Height:

Need to be visible from the truck cab when the trailer is submerged.
Typical heights: 40‚Äù, 60‚Äù.

Material:

PVC (white/black) - Rolls freely.
Carpeted Bunks - Provides friction/support but harder to center if far off.

Lights: Do we want LED pipe-lights on top? (Requires wiring integration).

title: Project: Trailer Guidepost Installation
text:
3. Action Plan

Inspect U-Bolts (High Priority):

Verify the measured U-bolt dimensions (1 1/8‚Äù x 1 1/8‚Äù I.D. and 22-24‚Äù depth).
Check for rust/corrosion on the threads.

Test Fit: Fit confirmed: 1.5‚Äù x 1.5‚Äù square aluminum tubing will fit within the U-bolts.
Measure Boat/Trailer: Confirm desired guidepost width and height relative to the boat hull.
Select Kit/Parts:

Scenario A (Reuse U-bolts): Buy 1.5‚Äù x 1.5‚Äù Square Aluminum Tubing + PVC Pipe + Caps.
Scenario B (New Brackets): Buy full Guide Post Kit compatible with 3‚Äù x 3‚Äù square trailer beams.

Order: Purchase materials.
Install:

Mount hardware/tubing.
Adjust width to fit the boat hull (leave ~1 inch gap on each side).
Test fit at the ramp.

title: Project: Trailer Guidepost Installation
text:
4. Potential Products

Magic Tilt OEM Parts: Check Magic Tilt catalog for square beam specific mounting brackets.
Aftermarket (C.E. Smith / Smith Guides): Verify ‚ÄúSquare Beam Clamp‚Äù availability.

title: Project: Trailer Guidepost Installation
text:
5. Log

Status: Planning / Measurement Phase.
